meanings.definition: A support or prop used to hold something in place.
meanings.sent1: The fulcra kept the shelf steady on the wall.
meanings.sent2: She placed the fulcra under the wobbly table to keep it from tipping over.
meanings.sent3: The fulcra was so strong, it even held up the heavy bookcase.
meanings.sent4: His unwavering support acted as a fulcra in her life, keeping her grounded.
meanings.sent5: The fulcra, like a superhero, swooped in to save the day by preventing the disaster.

meanings.definition: The point on which a lever rests or is supported.
meanings.sent1: The fulcra of the seesaw allowed the children to play together.
meanings.sent2: He adjusted the fulcra of the crowbar to lift the heavy object.
meanings.sent3: The fulcra seemed to enjoy being the center of attention in the physics class.
meanings.sent4: Her idea served as the fulcra for the project, making everything else fall into place.
meanings.sent5: The fulcra, like a pivot, determined the success of the experiment.
